node.title: DevPad
node.content:
A hyper-minimalistic project and task management tool designed specifically for developers.
After multiple iterations and redesigns, I'm currently working on a streamlined version
that focuses on simplicity and developer workflow integration.Researching how developers currently manage projects and tasks, what tools they use,
and where existing solutions fall short of their needs.Exploring why developers often prefer simple, focused tools over feature-heavy alternatives.
Sometimes the best tool is the one that gets out of your way and lets you focus on the work.Narrowed down to core features: project creation, task management, and simple time trackingBuilding a clean, distraction-free interface that prioritizes function over formIntegrate with git repositories, development tools, and common developer workflowsThe goal is to create a tool so simple and intuitive that it becomes invisible -
helping developers stay organized without adding cognitive overhead.

portfolio-showcase.title: Tom's Project Portfolio
portfolio-showcase.description:
A comprehensive showcase of projects spanning game development, web applications,
developer tools, and creative platforms. Each project represents a milestone in
my programming journey and demonstrates different aspects of software development.Active ProjectsGenerate daily & weekly reports of political sittings and distribute them to a user base
via a website experience & optional emails.Chamber aims to make political information more accessible by automatically generating
digestible reports from parliamentary proceedings and delivering them directly to citizens
who want to stay informed about their government's activities.Researched various sources for parliamentary data, including official government APIs,
web scraping opportunities, and data availability across different jurisdictions.Build the core system that processes parliamentary data and generates human-readable reportsImplement email subscription system with personalized report deliveryCreate user-friendly web interface for browsing reports and managing subscriptionsThis project represents my belief that technology should be used to increase civic
engagement and make democracy more accessible to everyday people.Blog site for all things on my creative side - a platform where I explore photography,
painting, music, and other artistic endeavors alongside my technical work.This project serves as a creative outlet and demonstrates my ability to build content
management systems while exploring the intersection of technology and art.Exploring how programming and artistic expression can complement and enhance each other.
Many of the same principles that make good code also make good art: composition,
balance, iteration, and attention to detail.Built a responsive gallery system for showcasing photography work with metadata and taggingIntegrate music player for original compositions and coversDocumenting my painting journey with progress photos, technique notes, and reflections.Just like coding, painting is about iteration, learning from mistakes, and gradually
building more complex skills on top of fundamental techniques.Game Development ProjectsA fast-paced multiplayer 1v1 capture the flag game built with GameMaker and Java backend.
This project combines my game development roots with my backend programming skills to
create a competitive multiplayer experience.Studied various multiplayer game architectures, latency compensation techniques,
and anti-cheat systems to inform the design decisions.Built the game client in GameMaker with smooth movement, responsive controls, and network communicationImplemented authoritative game server in Java with player synchronization and match managementDesign and implement skill-based matchmaking for balanced competitive matchesBuilding multiplayer games presents unique challenges around network synchronization,
latency compensation, and maintaining game state consistency across clients.Developer Tools & LibrariesAn open-source framework for interfacing between Java servers and GameMaker: Studio game clients.
This project solved a real problem I faced when building multiplayer games and has helped
other developers in the GameMaker community.Deep dive into GameMaker's networking capabilities, socket implementations, and
communication protocols to design an optimal interface layer.Built the foundational library with robust client-server communication protocolsCreated comprehensive documentation with code examples and getting-started guidesProvide ongoing support to developers using the library and maintain compatibilityThe library has been adopted by multiple independent game developers and has received
positive feedback from the GameMaker community.This project taught me valuable lessons about API design, documentation, backwards
compatibility, and maintaining open source projects.Web Applications & PlatformsA hyper-minimalistic project and task management tool designed specifically for developers.
After multiple iterations and redesigns, I'm currently working on a streamlined version
that focuses on simplicity and developer workflow integration.Researching how developers currently manage projects and tasks, what tools they use,
and where existing solutions fall short of their needs.Exploring why developers often prefer simple, focused tools over feature-heavy alternatives.
Sometimes the best tool is the one that gets out of your way and lets you focus on the work.Narrowed down to core features: project creation, task management, and simple time trackingBuilding a clean, distraction-free interface that prioritizes function over formIntegrate with git repositories, development tools, and common developer workflowsThe goal is to create a tool so simple and intuitive that it becomes invisible -
helping developers stay organized without adding cognitive overhead.Backend & Infrastructure ProjectsStack setup for a golang API with bun testing, postgres database, and S3 storage for
local & production environments. This project serves as a template and learning resource
for other developers looking to set up similar infrastructure.Comprehensive study of the Go ecosystem, comparing different frameworks, ORMs, and
deployment strategies to identify best practices and optimal tool combinations.Set up complete docker-compose environment with Go app, PostgreSQL, and MinIO (S3 compatible storage)Integrated Drizzle ORM for type-safe database operations with migrations and schema managementConfigured end-to-end testing pipeline using Bun for fast, reliable test executionCreated comprehensive documentation for deploying the stack to production environmentsThe repository has helped several developers bootstrap their Go API projects and serves
as a reference for modern Go development practices.This project demonstrates current best practices in API development, including
containerization, type safety, comprehensive testing, and clear documentation.Experimental & Learning ProjectsA project specifically designed to explore the transition from JavaScript to TypeScript
and experiment with different approaches to state management and task organization.Documented the process of migrating a JavaScript project to TypeScript, including
challenges faced, benefits realized, and lessons learned about type safety.Reflecting on the transition from dynamic to static typing, the initial resistance,
the gradual appreciation, and ultimately the realization that TypeScript makes
JavaScript development more enjoyable and productive.Built initial version in vanilla JavaScript to establish baseline functionalitySystematically migrated codebase to TypeScript, adding type definitions and improving code qualityCompared performance, developer experience, and code maintainability between JS and TS versionsThis project solidified my understanding of TypeScript's benefits and gave me practical
experience in migrating existing codebases to adopt type safety.Creative & Artistic ProjectsA curated collection of photography work spanning landscapes, street photography,
and experimental compositions. This creative pursuit complements my technical work
and provides a different lens for seeing and documenting the world.Continuous learning about composition, lighting, post-processing, and different
photographic styles to improve technical and artistic skills.Specialized focus on underwater photography while snorkeling, capturing marine life
and underwater landscapes. This challenging environment requires special techniques
and equipment considerations.Underwater photography presents unique challenges: limited light, water refraction,
marine life behavior, and equipment protection - similar to debugging complex systems!Select and organize best photographs into cohesive collections for online portfolioShare photography work on Instagram and other platforms to build an audience and get feedbackProfessional DevelopmentLed coaching for 8 different badminton teams at competitive city level, developing
leadership skills, teaching abilities, and team management experience that directly
translates to software development team dynamics.Studied effective coaching and teaching methodologies, sports psychology, and
team motivation techniques to become a more effective leader.Successfully managed and coordinated practice schedules, competitions, and development plans for 8 teamsCreated personalized training programs for players at different skill levels and tracked progressDeveloped game strategies, analyzed opponent patterns, and prepared teams for high-level competitionLed teams to compete successfully at the highest level in local city competitions,
with several teams achieving top placements.The leadership and analytical skills developed in sports coaching directly apply to
software development team leadership and code review processes.Reflection & Future DirectionsLooking across this portfolio of projects, several themes emerge that have shaped my
approach to software development and creative work:Iteration and Learning: Nearly every project has gone through multiple versions,
redesigns, or pivots. This isn't failure - it's the natural process of learning and
improving. Each iteration teaches something new about the problem space, user needs,
or technical constraints.Cross-Pollination: Skills learned in one domain consistently apply to others.
Leadership from coaching translates to software team dynamics. Visual composition
from photography improves UI design. Game development networking knowledge applies
to web API design.Community and Open Source: The projects that have had the most impact are those
that solve problems for others, not just myself. Open source contributions and
community resources create value that extends far beyond the initial effort.Balance of Technical and Creative: The most fulfilling projects combine technical
challenges with creative expression or meaningful impact. Pure technical exercises
are valuable for learning, but projects with purpose and personality are what I
remember and continue to develop.Explore how AI tools can enhance development workflows and create new possibilities
for creative and productivity applicationsDevelop projects that have positive environmental impact or help others make more
sustainable technology choicesCreate resources and tools that help other developers learn and grow, building on
my experience with documentation and teachingFuture projects will prioritize: meaningful impact, technical excellence, community value,
and personal growth. The goal is to build things that matter, not just things that work.Time spent curating and documenting this comprehensive project portfolio
